(1961, 2nd English edition, revised and reprinted). | pub_date = 1954 | english_pub_date = | media_type = Print ([[Hardcover]] and [[Paperback]]) | pages = 168 pp (Rebel paperback edition 1999) | isbn = ISBN 978-0-86241-905-9 (Rebel paperback edition 1999) ISBN 978-1-84749-042-1 (Oneworld Classics Edition 2008) | dewey= 823/.914 21 | congress= PR6070.R56 Y6 1999 | oclc= 43418858 | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''Young Adam''''' is a [[1954 in literature|1954]] novel by [[Alexander Trocchi]] which tells the story of Joe, a young man who labors on the [[barge|river barges]] of [[Glasgow]], and who discovers the body of a young woman floating in the canal. The novel focuses on the relationship between Joe and his companions on the barge – a husband and wife – and it becomes clearer as the novel progresses that Joe is connected to the dead woman he found. From this comes the saying, "I've shed my own skin and merged into the fog." This story was adapted to [[film]] as ''[[Young Adam (film)|Young Adam]]'' in [[2003 in film|2003]].
